page.title: 04LLANSAMLET PAST AND PRESENT
page.content: Mr Dai Smith was born on January 6th 1910.He told me all about the area of Llansamlet, past and present.He said: Llansamlet is a much healthier place now.People would walk along Peniel Green Rd. with hankies over their mouths, to stop the fumes of the copper and smelting getting in.People would die quite young because the smoke and fumes, would give them cancer.Years ago, the houses around the area were all dark brown, this was due to the industry.Now, they are bright colours.When you walked into Church Rd., it was like walking into a village.The church was always full, so were the Sunday schools.Children would pay two pence a week to go to school. On Llansamlet square, there used to be a little "Green" where the children would play, now it is a flower shop.Llansamlet park was a fair.
